name: cancel_subscription
description: Cancels a subscription in Stripe. Provide the ID of the subscription to be canceled as an argument.

subscription.description: The string ID of the subscription to cancel.

name: create_coupon
description: Creates a coupon in Stripe. Define the discount using either `percent_off` or `amount_off`; only one of these parameters can be provided, and if `amount_off` is used, the `currency` parameter must also be set (it defaults to 'USD'). The coupon's duration is controlled by the `duration` parameter, accepting 'once', 'repeating', or 'forever' (defaulting to 'once'); if `duration` is 'repeating', the `duration_in_months` parameter is required.

name.description: A string representing the name of the coupon, which is displayed to customers on invoices or receipts. This parameter must not be an empty string.

amount_off.description: A positive integer indicating the amount to subtract from an invoice total. This parameter is required.

currency.description: A three-letter ISO currency code (e.g., 'USD', 'EUR') for the `amount_off` parameter. This parameter is required if `amount_off` is used to define the discount and `percent_off` is not provided; it defaults to 'USD'.

duration.description: Specifies how long the discount will last. Valid values are 'once', 'repeating', or 'forever', with 'once' as the default. If set to 'repeating', the `duration_in_months` parameter is required to define the number of months the discount applies.

percent_off.description: A positive float representing the percentage discount applied by the coupon. It must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 100. If provided, this parameter defines the coupon's discount instead of `amount_off`.

duration_in_months.description: Specifies the number of months the discount will apply. This parameter is required and must be a positive integer if the `duration` parameter is set to 'repeating'.

name: create_customer
description: Creates a new customer in Stripe. Specify the customer's name, which is required, and optionally provide an email address.

name.description: Specifies the customer's full name or business name. This string cannot be empty or contain only whitespace.

email.description: The customer's email address. This parameter is an optional string.

name: create_invoice
description: Creates an invoice in Stripe. Specify the customer's ID for whom to create the invoice and optionally provide the number of days until the invoice is due.

customer.description: The ID of the customer for whom to create the invoice. This parameter must be a non-empty string that corresponds to an existing customer.

days_until_due.description: The optional number of days until the invoice is due. If provided, this must be a non-negative integer.

name: create_invoice_item
description: Creates an invoice item in Stripe. This function uses the provided customer ID, price ID, and invoice ID to associate the new invoice item with the respective customer, product/service price, and invoice.

customer.description: The ID of the customer for whom the invoice item will be created. This parameter must be a non-empty string and correspond to an existing customer.

price.description: The ID of the price for the item. This must be a non-empty string that corresponds to an existing and active price.

invoice.description: The ID of the invoice to which the item will be associated. This string must be a non-empty and valid identifier for an existing invoice.

name: create_payment_link
description: Creates a payment link in Stripe. This function requires the ID of the price and the quantity of the product to include in the link.

price.description: The ID of the price to create the payment link for. This parameter must be a non-empty string that corresponds to an existing and active price ID.

quantity.description: The quantity of the product to include. This parameter must be an integer greater than 0.

name: create_price
description: Creates a new price in Stripe using a specified product ID, a non-negative unit amount in cents, and a currency. A product must be created first if not already specified.

product.description: The string ID of an existing product. A price can only be created for a product that already exists.

currency.description: Specifies the currency of the price. This must be a three-letter ISO currency code (e.g., `usd`).

unit_amount.description: Specifies the unit amount of the price, expressed in cents. It must be a non-negative integer and defaults to None.

name: create_product
description: Creates a product in Stripe. It accepts a mandatory name for the product and an optional description to further detail it.

name.description: The mandatory name of the product. This string parameter cannot be empty.

description.description: An optional string that provides the product's description.

name: create_refund
description: Refunds a specified payment intent in Stripe. Provide the `payment_intent` ID as a string, and optionally specify the `amount` to refund as an integer in cents, along with an optional `reason` for the refund as a string.

payment_intent.description: The string ID of the PaymentIntent to refund. This ID must not be empty and must correspond to an existing, successfully completed PaymentIntent.

amount.description: Specifies the amount to be refunded. This value must be provided in cents.

reason.description: An optional string indicating the reason for the refund.

name: finalize_invoice
description: Finalizes an invoice in Stripe. Provide the string ID of the invoice to finalize.

invoice.description: The ID of the invoice to finalize. This parameter must be a non-empty string.

name: list_coupons
description: Fetches a list of Coupons from Stripe. It accepts an optional `limit` parameter, an integer that specifies the number of coupons to return and must be between 1 and 100.

limit.description: Specifies the maximum number of objects to return. This limit must be an integer between 1 and 100.

name: list_customers
description: Fetches a list of Customers from Stripe. Optionally, specify a `limit` (an integer between 1 and 100) to control the number of customers retrieved, or provide an `email` string to filter customers by their email address in a case-sensitive manner.

limit.description: Specifies the maximum number of objects to be returned. This integer value must be between 1 and 100.

email.description: Filters the list of customers by their email address. This parameter accepts a string value and applies the filter in a case-sensitive manner.

name: list_disputes
description: Fetches a list of Stripe disputes. Optionally filter disputes by an associated charge ID or PaymentIntent ID, and limit the number of results between 1 and 100, defaulting to 10.

charge.description: An optional charge ID used to filter disputes. When provided, only disputes associated with this string ID will be returned.

payment_intent.description: Filters returned disputes to include only those associated with the specified PaymentIntent ID. This parameter defaults to `None`.

limit.description: Specifies the maximum number of objects to return. This limit must be an integer between 1 and 100, and its default value is 10.

name: list_payment_intents
description: List payment intents in Stripe. Optionally filter these intents by a specific `customer` ID or control the number of returned intents using the `limit` parameter, which accepts an integer between 1 and 100.

customer.description: The optional ID of the customer for whom to list payment intents. It must be a string.

limit.description: Limits the number of objects returned to a value between 1 and 100.

name: list_prices
description: Fetches a list of Prices from Stripe. It accepts an optional `product` ID to filter prices for a specific product, and an optional `limit` (1-100) to control the number of prices returned.

product.description: The ID of the product for which to list prices. If specified, this parameter must be a non-empty string that starts with `prod_`, such as `prod_123`. It defaults to `None`.

limit.description: Specifies the maximum number of objects to return. This value must be an integer between 1 and 100, inclusive, and defaults to 10.

name: list_products
description: Fetch a list of Products from Stripe. It accepts an optional `limit` argument to specify the maximum number of products to return. The `limit` must be an integer between 1 and 100, and defaults to 10.

limit.description: The maximum number of objects to return. This value must be an integer between 1 and 100; the default is 10.

name: list_subscriptions
description: Lists all subscriptions in Stripe, allowing results to be filtered by customer ID, price ID, or status (e.g., 'active', 'past_due', 'canceled', 'all'), and limited to between 1 and 100 returned subscriptions.

customer.description: A string representing the ID of the customer for whom to list subscriptions; it must begin with `cus_`.

price.description: The ID of the price used to filter subscriptions. This string must begin with 'price_' (e.g., 'price_xyz123').

status.description: Specifies the status of subscriptions to retrieve. The parameter accepts the following values: 'active', 'past_due', 'unpaid', 'canceled', 'incomplete', 'incomplete_expired', 'trialing', or 'all'.

limit.description: Specifies the maximum number of objects to be returned, with the limit ranging from 1 to 100.

name: retrieve_balance
description: Retrieves the Stripe account balance, which includes both available funds ready for payout and pending funds, without requiring any input.

name: update_dispute
description: Updates a dispute by allowing for the submission of evidence. Based on the `submit` parameter, evidence can be submitted immediately for review or staged on the dispute for a later submission. Updating any field within the `evidence` hash submits all fields in that hash.

dispute.description: The unique identifier of the dispute to be updated.

cancellation_policy_disclosure.description: An explanation detailing how and when the customer was shown your refund policy prior to completing the purchase.

duplicate_charge_explanation.description: An explanation clarifying the difference between the disputed charge and a prior charge that appears to be its duplicate.

uncategorized_text.description: Any additional evidence or statements that do not fit into a specific category.

evidence.description: A hash of evidence fields to submit in response to a dispute. Updating any field within this hash will resubmit all provided evidence fields for review. This hash requires a specific set of expected keys.

submit.description: A boolean that determines whether to submit evidence to the bank immediately. If `false`, the evidence is staged on the dispute instead.

name: update_subscription
description: Updates an existing subscription in Stripe. To modify a subscription item, the existing item must be deleted and the new one must be added.

subscription.description: The unique identifier of the subscription to be updated.

proration_behavior.description: Specifies how to handle prorations when subscription items change. Valid options are `create_prorations`, `always_invoice`, `none_implicit`, or `none`.

id.description: The ID of the subscription item to modify.

price.description: The ID of the price to switch to.

quantity.description: The quantity of the plan to subscribe to.

items.description: A list of subscription items to update, add, or remove. Each item in the list must be a dictionary that defines the properties for a single subscription item.
